page.title: 07THE OWSLEBURY WARRIOR
page.content: In Owslebury we had an archaeological dig in Mr.P.Hellard's grounds. An Iron Age warrior was found. It was called the "OWSLEBURY WARRIOR" and it had been preserved on Mr Hellard's property for about two and a half thousand years. A few days after the arcaeoloigical discovery of the "OWSLEBURY WARRIOR", a worker on Mr Hellard's farm, called Bottom Pond Farm, hit some stones whilst ploughing a field. After further investigation the arcaeologists were recalled and started a further dig. After three to five years work they found out that they were the remains of Iron Age and Romano-British settlements. The "OWSLEBURY WARRIOR" is now in the CITY MUSEUM IN WINCHESTER.
